bug.author: kuri54
bug.description: Python==3.6 Turi Create==5.5 model = tc.image_classifier.create(train_data) metrics = model.evaluate(test_data) print(metrics['accuracy']) -> 0.822 print(metrics['auc']) -> 0.906 print(metrics['roc_curve']) -> KeyError : ['roc_curve'] It had been done for a while.I can not do it for some reason. ROC_curve can be drawn if this output can be done. Is there any other way?

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kuri54>@kuri54</denchmark-link> - Thanks for reporting this issue. It looks like this is caused by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/pull/1335>#1335</denchmark-link> . The roc_curve is still calculated by logistic regression but <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/blob/752e0e4d88f692e4135031bd4673a8110b2ff783/src/unity/python/turicreate/toolkits/image_classifier/image_classifier.py#L768>it is not being passed through</denchmark-link> . We should get this fixed in the next release. If you can downgrade to 5.2.1, you can get the ROC Curve.
